# Copilot Instructions for Violet-Site-Systems/.github

## Repository Purpose

This is the `.github` repository for the Violet-Site-Systems organization. It contains:
- Organization profile pages displayed at `https://github.com/Violet-Site-Systems`
- Profile documentation and guides
- VS Code settings and configuration

## Design Philosophy

**Minimalist vibe with purple and violet aesthetics**
- Favor clean, focused designs over cluttered layouts
- Embrace purple/violet color palette (#240046, #3C096C, #560BAD, #7209B7, #9D4EDD, #C77DFF, #E0AAFF)
- Modern, high-tech styling with elegant touches
- "Less is more" - keep content concise and impactful

## File Conventions

### profile/README.md
- **Purpose**: Main organization profile page displayed on GitHub
- **Style**: Modern, high-tech, purple gradient theme
- **Content**: Organization info, tech stack, projects, community links
- **Keep**: Animations, visual elements, and dynamic content
- **Update**: When organization information, projects, or stats change

### Documentation Files
- Use clear, hierarchical markdown structure
- Include emoji where appropriate for visual appeal ðŸŽ¨
- Keep examples practical and actionable
- Maintain consistent formatting across files

## Markdown & Visual Elements

### Preferred Badges
```markdown
![Text](https://img.shields.io/badge/TEXT-COLOR?style=for-the-badge&logo=LOGO&logoColor=white)
```
- Use `style=for-the-badge` for consistency
- Align with purple color scheme when possible

### External Services
- **Capsule Render**: Animated headers (https://capsule-render.vercel.app)
- **Typing SVG**: Dynamic text animations (https://readme-typing-svg.demolab.com)
- **Shields.io**: Badges and status indicators
- **GitHub Stats**: Organization statistics visualization

### Mermaid Diagrams
- Use for flowcharts, roadmaps, and process visualization
- Apply purple/violet color scheme in diagram styling
- Keep diagrams clean and uncluttered

## Color Palette

Primary palette (dark to light):
- `#240046` - Deep purple (darkest)
- `#3C096C` - Dark violet
- `#560BAD` - Medium purple
- `#7209B7` - Bright purple
- `#9D4EDD` - Light purple
- `#C77DFF` - Pastel purple
- `#E0AAFF` - Pale violet (lightest)

Accent colors:
- `#00F7FF` - Cyan for highlights
- `#FF006E` - Magenta for emphasis

## Best Practices

### When Creating Content
- Lead with visual impact (headers, animations, graphics)
- Use whitespace effectively
- Break content into digestible sections
- Include clear calls-to-action

### When Editing
- Preserve existing visual structure
- Test external links and images
- Verify badge URLs and parameters
- Maintain responsive design (mobile-friendly)

### When Adding Features
- Ensure alignment with minimalist philosophy
- Prioritize purple/violet aesthetic
- Keep animations subtle and professional
- Test on both light and dark GitHub themes

## Testing Changes

### Before Committing
1. Preview markdown locally or use GitHub's preview
2. Verify all external images load
3. Check badge rendering
4. Test Mermaid diagram syntax
5. Validate links are functional
6. Review on mobile viewport

### Organization Profile
- Changes to `profile/README.md` appear at organization page
- May take a few moments to update on GitHub
- Clear browser cache if changes don't appear

## Tone & Voice

- Professional yet approachable
- Tech-forward and innovative
- Inclusive and welcoming
- Confident but not boastful

**Tagline**: "Bridging The Whispers Of AI"

## Common Tasks

### Update Organization Info
- Edit `profile/README.md`
- Update badges with current tech stack
- Refresh GitHub stats username parameters
- Update project links and descriptions

### Add New Examples
- Create new section in `profile/EXAMPLES.md`
- Include complete markdown code
- Add customization notes
- Maintain purple theme consistency

### Modify Colors
- Update palette in relevant sections
- Adjust Capsule Render parameters
- Modify badge color codes
- Update Mermaid diagram styles
- Test contrast and readability

## What NOT to Change

- Core purple/violet color scheme
- Minimalist design philosophy
- Organization tagline (unless explicitly requested)
- External service URLs (unless service is deprecated)

## Additional Notes

- This is an organization `.github` repository - it's meta!
- Focus on visual excellence and brand consistency
- The profile page is the organization's public face
- Keep documentation clear and beginner-friendly
